page.title: 18RECREATION
page.content: The increase in popularity of cheap foreign travel, together with an increase in pollution of the River Mersey and the gradual erosion of the beaches lead to the decline of New Brighton. Even today, several hotels and houses display "For Sale" signs. Many premises in Virginia and Victoria Roads are empty and derelict. In recent years there has been an increase of interest in New Brighton as a recreation and amusement centre. Pop concerts have been staged at the open-air swimming baths. The Floral Pavilion theatre is often filled to capacity. The tennis courts, amusement arcades, bowling greens, sea fishing, crazy golf, bowling aley and restaurents attract, not only locals, but also more and more people from Liverpool.
